channel.title: Colony
channel.description:
[b][size=14pt]Colony[/size][/b] After a 2 year break from private servers, I thought I would start working on one again. My aim for the server is to follow after the current RuneScape Oldschool server, with other content that will make it unique at the same time. Development will be pretty slow for right now due to work, so I have no fixed date on when the server will be online.
[b]Patch Notes[/b] [spoiler][QUOTE] Note that all updates haven't been recorded. 10/11: - Ring of slaying now teleports you to a new slayer dungeon - Remade the crystal chest system
10/12: - New player-title base added (titles will be added in future update) - Experience multipliers have been changed (50x all combat stats, 100x all skilling stats) - Implemented a new combat rank system - [S]New orb on client gameframe displays combat level[/S] - Under 'Combat' on the quest tab, it now shows your combat rank - New dungeons/areas started to follow along with new combat ranking system - Ranking: - 1-19 - 20-49 Apprentice - 50-74 Outlaw - 75-99 Renegade - 100-109 Assassin - 110-126 Fabled - 126 Master
10/13: - Scroll of Advocator added (tradeable donation-status item) - CPI updates - Removed combat level from gameframe, added run orb back - Fixed some player walking issues - Updated clue scroll caskets - Many updates to the home area - Minor updates to the Slayer skill - Mini-event added - Halloween 2014
10/14: pt1 - Training in the wilderness now grants 2x the normal experience - Starter kits updated - Each month a new cosmetic item will be added to starter kits, ex: October = Jack o lantern mask - These items will be untradeble, and show when the user created their account - Teleport tabs have been added
10/14: pt2 - Nightmare Zone updates - Overload potions now only work in the Nightmare Zone
10/15: - New slayer tasks added which now grant slayer points - Created a task system base - Re-wrote majority of the Warrior's guild code, and also added the following: - Require's a combat level of 100 to enter the guild - Token degrading works just like RS - Supports up to Dragon defenders - Everything is working in the guild, minus those other little mini-games that I'm not going to bother with
10/16: pt1 - Equipment stats screen now works properly - Removed clan chat for now - Fighter torso's can now be purchased from Anton (Warrior's guild) for 2,000 tokens - You can now reset your slayer task by selecting 'Clear-task' on Duradel for 3 Slayer points - Quest tab now displays how many more creatures need to be slain for your task - Quest tab now displays your player rights - Finished Nightmare zone rewards shop - Finished Slayer rewards shop - Zamorak boss now drops Staff of the dead - Kraken boss added, requires 87 Slayer and drops Trident of the seas (not finished) - Callisto wilderness boss added, drops Odium and Malediction wards - Smoke devils now drops Occult necklaces - Basic clue scrolls added
10/16: pt2 - Added 3 new thieving stalls (silver, spice, gem) - Added new NPC 'The Merchant' who runs the blackmarket (Thieving shop) - Thieving experience balances - Updated some slayer creatures drop tables - Rock-shell armour added to slayer rewards shop - Praying at the Mage's bank god statues now gives you a god cape and staff - Armadyl crossbow added to Commander Zilyana's drop table
10/17: - Brimhaven dungeon finished, now requires 3,000 coins to enter - Taverley dungeon finished - Edgeville dungeon finished - Varrock sewers dungeon finished - Removed loads of unnused NPC spawns in place of useful ones - Full NPC spawns added: - Al Kharid - Falador - Lumbridge - Relleka - Port Sarim - Rimmington - Wilderness
10/18: - Re-wrote Barrows minigame
10/19: pt1 - Removed clan chat and music tab icons from gameframe - Modern teleports now teleport you to their correct locations (varrock, falador, etc) - Modern teleports now require runes - Modern teleports now require correct levels - 3 new modern teleports added: Watchtower, Trollheim, Ape Atoll - Ardougne city spawns added
10/19: pt2 - Ancient teleports now teleport you to their correct locations - Ancient teleports now require runes - Ancient teleports now require correct levels - Lunar teleports now teleport you to their correct locations - Lunar teleports require runes - Lunar teleports require correct levels - Ourania teleport brings you to the Ourania altar that will now restore your health, prayer, and special attack energy - Recipe for Disaster mini quest added - All RFD gloves can be purchased from RFD chest and now require completion of RFD mini quest
10/20: pt1 - Spellbooks now require correct Magic level to access - You now have to walk to the Edgeville monastery to change your spellbook - Low level training areas added around Edgeville: - Monks - Ice mountain - Dwarves - Black knight's fortress
10/20: pt2 - Wall safe cracking support added - 7 new guilds added (cooking, fishing, crafting, mining, thieving, ranged, magic) - Right clicking the skillcapes that have a guild will show a 'Guild' teleport option - Each guild has special rewards for mastering the skill: - [b]Cooking[/b]: Access to cooking gauntlets, plus sea turtle food that heals 23 hp (shop limit 300) Includes bank and cooking range
- [b]Fishing[/b]: Raw food available in shop: shark, manta ray, and sea turtle (sea turtle shop limit 300) Includes bank and fishing spots
- [b]Crafting[/b]: High level gems available in shop: dragonstone, onyx (onyx shop limit 5) Includes mining spots
- [b]Mining[/b]: Access to runite ore spawns (2) and adamantite ore spawns (3) Includes bank
- [b]Thieving[/b]: Access to Rogue's outfit in shop, wall safe cracking Wall safe cracking requires 1x lockpick, grants 1x 'ancient coin' and can be sold to store for higher price than regular thieving items
- [b]Ranged[/b]: Access to Dragonstone bolts, Onyx bolts, and Dragon arrows
- [b]Magic[/b]: Access to Infinity robes
10/21: - Resource shards added - Added 3 skills that have a random chance of giving you shards: mining, fishing, woodcutting (more will be added in the future) - Survival expert can exchange your resource shards for skilling outfits/items - Mining skill updates - Fishing skill updates - Woodcutting skill updates
10/26: - Started working on new home area - Lunar isle - Flax picking added - 3 fishing spawns added to 'pool' area: shrimp, trout/salmon, lobster
10/27: - Removed all doors on Lunar isle (will eventually add support for doors there) - Almost all staircases now working on Lunar isle - Most NPC spawns added to Lunar isle [spoiler] [/QUOTE] [/spoiler]
[b]Media[/b] [spoiler]Starter update [img]http://www.upload.ee/image/4308788/starter-update.png[/img]

[size=8pt][b]Beta[/b] I will most likely end up hosting for a few days just for testing purposes before it's full release, so send me a message if you would like to help test. I'm looking for around 5-10 people.[/size]

item.title: Colony
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Arham’s varrock was decently created. If the server had gained a bigger following then honestly it would have panned out well.

And I think tutorials about the server specifically are good, and if players are willing to take the time to learn about it then they should receive basically a reward for gaining knowledge about the server. The only reason I think something like the starter set should be awarded upon completion is that all too many times servers will begin to set up a good basis on what shops should be included and what tiers should be available, but then they offer a ridiculous start set with like 5 mill gp. That is the kind of stuff that destroys your economy from the beginning.

If you want to do a melee, ranger, magician starter pack thing then I really would suggest just giving them the basic gear to get started so they can do begin killing things for money, but none of that crap where people get iron, mithril, addy, runite gear off the get go. That’s just stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Colony
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Honestly, I’ve always liked Varrock as a Home when I played an eco server. When I played a pk server than I didn’t mind the home being edgeville it was always good.

Read full topic

item.title: Colony
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Elrick:

Make them learn the land.

Really bad. Results in a ton of quiting. We did this in Rome and made the home Taverley. Nearly nobody could find their way, even though the minimap had CLEAR ICONS of where everything was. Kiddies are clueless.

[quote=“ox random xi, post:77, topic:547270”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=666176.msg4457130#msg4457130 date=1415556683]
If you wanted to go lore friendly or give a backstory, you could just do something like “You wake up from a night of heavy drinking in an unfamiliar tavern…” I think if you’re going to do a good starter kit then make the players at least go through some dialogue and maybe like a pseudo-quest. Make them learn the land.
[/quote]we did that with our quests and I really don’t recall the feedback. I like and dislike servers that have tutorials. I like they’re available but If I’m making an alt I dont want to go through it again.[/quote]
Yes, make tutorials not about basics but about the gameplay.

ox random xi:

P.S. I feel Varrock is too big for a small server, it divides it and they rarely use the whole town because they rather talk to each other at a central ‘hub’ ie grand exchange… but also referring to what Arham was saying

It is arguable. I mean, if you make alot of the skills available in home, it does become a hub by itself. But then again, it probably IS too big. You COULD use the GE, but GE has like no support for skilling.

Read full topic

item.title: Colony
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Ruby:

Stealing my ideas Arham

<3

ox random xi:

Nope, it looks organized. Just remember to utilize it more than often, because teleporting to a lot of areas to skill may seem like you’re utilizing the world but the players always seem to hate it.

You need a central hub for players to be in, and that should typically be home. But, with the theme servers now-a-days go with, teleporting to every place in the map, there is no central hub at all…

[quote=“Ruby, post:50, topic:547270”]I mean, I used Edgeville until about 600 players then changed to Falador and quickly after to Al-Kharid.

A small home isn’t a bad thing to begin with, it keeps the community together. I just got lazy and didn’t change it. After about 200 online at one time Edge gets very busy and a pain in the ass so once you start hitting like a constant 100+ online I’d start looking for a new place if that’s what you’re finding.

It’s different to every server, it depends what the community looks for nowadays. For example, mines loved PvP. Edgeville was convenient for that and there was a bit of space to trade for those who liked to trade. It served me well. I wouldn’t go to something like Varrock or anything until a larger playerbase, like I said, usually 100-150 online at once is when I would start looking to transition.

Maybe make an attempt at using Seers or maybe even the Barbarian village?

Seers and the Barb would be nice for starting communities but will get very very crowded after about 50 people at once I reckon.[/quote]

Seers’ Village:

[ul][li]Support for 3 income-making skills (woodcutting, crafting, fishing)[/li]
[li]Bar could be a hub?[/li]
[li]Castle is great for a lore.[/li]
[li]Alter is nice.[/li][/ul]

Barbarian Village:

[ul][li]Support for like 3 skills (crafting, fishing, mining) (woodcutting too barely).[/li]
[li]Cave entrance, perfect as a training area entrance.[/li]
[li]Ongoing fire could be helpful[/li]
[li]A great place for crafting.[/li][/ul]

[hr]

To be honest, I love Varrock. It has everything you could possibly need and everybody knows their way around Varrock. Woodcutting, Fishing, Construction, Hunter, Mining, Prayer, all sorts of skills! Also, the center of Varrock is a perfect hub. There are shops everywhere. Varrock is also near Barbarian Village and the Wildy.

Read full topic

item.title: Colony
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

[quote=“Exion, post:64, topic:547270”][quote author=Scully link=topic=666176.msg4456094#msg4456094 date=1414989433]

Rock Crabs are seriously the most boring things to train on. Every time I hop on a server that is using rock crabs to train on, I get bored and afk in less than 5 minutes. By now even I know it’s not that hard to change the stat values on monsters to give it low defense and high hp. I detest the Fremmenik area simply because RSPS have just raped that spot for ~6 years so players can train on gray blobs. We need to finally be better than this.

I was actually going to use rock crabs for the home area, but I changed it to yaks instead. I totally agree though.

What client are you using, out of curiosity?
[/quote]
Eliminate’s currently.[/quote]

Thanks

Read full topic
